name: San Francisco Marriott Union Square

reviews.text: I enjoyed everything about my stay at the Crowne Plaza. The location was great; near Union square shops, handy to the cable car (if you like that form of transport - I prefer foot). The food at the conference I attended was excellent. The internet connection could have been cheaper though - like free. I've stayed in cheaper hotels where it's free. The relaxation pack provided was a bit of a gimmick, but nice that they tried. The staff were all very friendly and courteous. Overall very enjoyable, and would stay again.
reviews.title: Great location
Wonderful everything!
reviews.text: San Fran was our first port of call on a month long trip. We arrived before checkin time but they allowed us to check straight in. The service was second to none, with everyone from the front desk and concierge to the bartender/room service (a special mention to Tom) totally professional, courteous and friendly. Our room was well appointed, well serviced and large. We liked it so much we rebooked for our return to San Fran before flyng home to Australia. It's handy to shops, restaurants and local attractions. The cable cars to Fishermans wharf run alongside the hotel and Chinatown is just around the corner. It's a tad expensive but we definitely got what we paid for.
We came to San Francisco for a family holiday and were greatly surprised and pleased with our stay and service from the staff at this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Crowne

reviews.text: The conceirge and door staff were very knowledgable and assisted at every opportunity. The front desk staff were really pleasant and helpful as well.
reviews.title: Very average

reviews.text: The beds were outstanding and great to fall into at the end of our day.
reviews.title: Very nice, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights and the experience was delightful. Staff couldn't be more helpful. Our room was very spacious with great views down Powell and west to Ocean Beach. This was our 3rd stay in SF and this was without doubt the best hotel and not the most expensive we've stayed in. 1 block from Union square with the cable car going past the hotel, this is ideal for shopping and access to the excellent public transport system. We would recommend this hotel for business or vacation, it is unpretentious and the effort is therefore put into making the guests stay hassel free.
reviews.title: Wonderful Unpretentious Hotel

reviews.text: This was a great hotel stay. I was in town for less than fun reasons (my father was having surgery) so having a nice retreat was wonderful. The room was large and very clean. The bed and bedding were cozy. Had dinner at the end of the day at the restaurant on site and had a delicious dinner. The location is good, close to Union Square and theaters. The staff was very nice. Free internet would be a welcomed improvement, though.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Great stay!
reviews.text: My wife and I just got back from spending 4 nights at the Crowne Plaza.
Good:
reviews.title: Very pleased with hotel

reviews.text: Staff- The staff was one of the highlights of this hotel. Every employee said hello or asked how we were doing whether it was the doorman or one of the maids.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a frequent business traveler and stayed at the hotel for a personal reason, so I wasn't sure what I'd get for the money. This was an unexpectedly wonderful hotel. I used priceline to get 2 nights at $300 with tax included -- a steal in San Francisco's Union Square. It was a great stay, and the best part was the staff. They were nice, helpful, and caring. When we forgot our shampoo, they immediately shipped it to us. I really was surprised at what I got for the money. I'd stay again in a minute.
reviews.title: Amazing - An Economical Gem

reviews.text: My company booked this hotel for me based on location and price. Yes, the location is great, especially since I'm a Bay Area native, now living in Central Texas and was looking forward to a city "fix".
reviews.title: Good price, maybe worth it after rennovations done

reviews.text: The room was a decent size (especially compared to European standards) and clean. The bed was very comfortable, and housekeeping kept the room very clean.
reviews.title: Great value - get it while it lasts

reviews.text: The main problem was that I only stayed 5 nights, and 3 times the heat was off. The first time, a worker came and told me they had just turned the heat back on and he wanted to make sure it was working--turned off for renovations in another part of hotel. Another time, I came back to my room and the thermostat had been turned off. The last morning, the thermostat was not working at all.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: I also came back one evening to no lights in my entry way or bath. They fixed the problem while I was out for dinner, but in my opinion I had one too many issues during my short stay.
reviews.title: Great Location at a fantastic price!

reviews.text: We stayed 7 nights first of Jan. 06. Location was perfect, could not have found a better place. Cable car few feet from our door, area very flat (for SF), close to shopping; restaurants. Just a couple of blocks from China Town. This was our first trip to SF and I don't think we could have found a better location. Room very quiet, very, very clean, staff very helpful. No problems whatsoever. Would definitely stay in this exact same location again.
reviews.title: Crown Plaza - Great location

reviews.text: Great location. Walk to shops/restaurants in Union Square and Nob Hill. Convinient to public transportation. Rooms above average, clean. Stayed in the "quiet zone" which was nice-- wasn't bothered by street noise like in a lot of the other Union Square hotels. Would stay here again, good value for the SF area if you can find a deal online.
reviews.title: Reasonable SF hotel
Just PERFECT!!
reviews.text: Booked two rooms when staying in San Francisco for a friend's birthday treat. I travel a lot on business - this hotel exceeded my expectations. It was one of the best decisions of the trip. I split the holiday between two hotels in the city and really regretted leaving the Crowne Plaza.
(1) Location
reviews.title: Great location, great service, small room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 3-night stay. Very pleasant, low-key, quiet, boutique-like.
reviews.title: Superior Full-Service Marriott, but ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM: New and spiffy, "Compact" bathroom didn't bother me. Most glaring omission: NO SAFE in a brand-new Marriott: unforgivable and unbelievable. Flat-panel TV with analog signal; why don't you make the internet connection dial-up to go along with the fuzzy TV picture. By the way, no HBO, but STARZ, which turned out to be FOX Business Channel. Note to management: give us real coffee mugs instead of WASTEFUL paper cups in the room!
reviews.title: Very Relaxing Stay

reviews.text: CONCIERGE LOUNGE: very nice, roomy, high quality food but limited selections consistent with recent downgrades across the country. Closed Saturday, reopened Sunday late afternoon.
reviews.title: First Review of complete Renovation- Excellent Choice

reviews.text: GYM: new Life Fitness treadmills (6) , striders (3), and bikes (3); all with TV's. A water fountain (instead of the current dispenser) would save all the throwaway cups. Aren't you Californians suppose to be more environmentally-aware?
reviews.title: Great Room, Friendly Service, Fantastic Location

reviews.text: LOCATION: probably the best feature. Close to most tourist traps (cable cars, shopping, Chinatown)
reviews.title: It is changing to a Marriott on April 1 2009- Needs some fine tuning

reviews.text: Generally, I dislike almost everything about Crowne Plaza hotels. It's definitely my least favorite "mid-scale" hotel brand. But I was pleasantly surprised by the Crowne Plaza-Union Square in San Francisco. All in all, this property is not bad.
reviews.title: Not bad, all in all

reviews.text: For starters, the rooms are relatively spacious, at least by San Francisco standards. The location is excellent. And the rate was relatively inexpensive by San Francisco standards. (I was fortunate enough to qualify for a corporate rate that was about 40% less than the hotel's standard rack rate.) To top it off, the view from my room on the 23rd floor was outstanding. (Rooms on upper level floors with views of San Francisco Bay command a slight rack rate surcharge. But the surcharge is apparently waived for some corporate-rate guests.)
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised at the Crowne

likes.liked: — Views from the upper floors -- astonishing!

reviews.text: My dislikes about the hotel: A very bland, uninspiring decorating scheme, which seems to be highly typical of most Crowne Plaza locations. Inadequate air conditioning in the lobby, elevators, hallways and other common areas. (The weather was unusually warm during my stay, with temperatures in the mid 70s.) Somewhat worn and outdated room furnishings and carpenting.
reviews.title: Very Good Option For SFO

likes.disliked: — no safety box and mini bar in my room

reviews.text: Would I stay here again? Yes, if the price was right.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: Would I stay here if I had to pay anything close to the rack rate? Definitely not.
reviews.title: Great location, great service

reviews.text: If you have read the earlier reviews I can tell you that everyone was dead on about the 480. The 480 is located at "480" Sutter Street. Very easy to remember where your hotel is when the name of the hotel is where the hotel is.
reviews.title: Loved The 480!

likes.liked: — The Room! Everything about it.. The comfortable bed and linens/comforter, the colors/decorations, the bathroom, coffee maker, tv, etc.
likes.disliked: — We were a family of 3 and only had glasses/cups for 2in the room. Would have liked the front desk staff to be more friendly. They almost seemed too professional.

reviews.text: Brought the family to S.F. for the Chinese New Year Parade and festivities. We were only 1 block from the parade and of course very close to all of the festivities. I liked everything about our room. The beds were very comfortable. There was a nice, thick comfy bedspread with 4 pillows on each bed. We had a flat screen tv but didn't really have much time to watch it. There is a nice alcove that holds a small coffee pot for coffee/tea. The headboard has two reading lights as mentioned below. The colors/decorating were very nice. The bathroom has a light in the shower if you want to just have it on so as to not disburb other family members sleeping when showering. (The bathroom has a frosted glass sliding door so I was concerned the light might be too bright). We were unsure as to where the parking garage was for the hotel and ended up parking in another lot which I understand was quite a bit less expensive.
reviews.title: Great Rooms

reviews.text: We ran into the cleaning lady in the hall in the morning and she was very nice. The bellmen/doormen were very nice, friendly and helpful. The next time we come back to S.F. we will definetely stay at the 480. And this time it will be longer than just one night. Kudos 480 for a very nice job on the renovation and for the friendly and helpful service.
reviews.title: An absolute gem! It is now on my favorite list.

likes.disliked: — Nothing; it would have been nice to be on a higher floor for a better view of the city

reviews.text: We booked a room with two beds but when we checked-in they had none available so they upgraded us to a Jr. Suite which was sweet. The rooms are big & nice especially the bathroom. The hotel smells brand new but the only problem was the exterior of the hotel which is undergoing construction. We did not hear any construction; this is a great place plus it's located near Union Square. We will definately stay there again but beware the parking is $46 per day however, there is a parking garage right next to it which is cheaper for only $30. I would recommend to park there instead.
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel - best bargain for a 4+ star in SF-Enjoy it while you can

reviews.text: I was first attracted to this hotel because it was in my price range; I heard SF was very expensive so being my first time, I was happy to find a hotel until $150 a night (I actually got it for $110/night).
reviews.title: Great location, totally woth the money

reviews.text: Based on other reviews my husband booked a room here over another hotel he stayed at previously. I can't believe the clean, stylish rooms at the room rate we paid. There is still renovations going on in the lobby and exterior, probably the reason for the low room rate. But this was definitely the best by for our $. Hopefully the roomrates are still affordable on our next trip back to SF. Walgreens, Diner and Starbucks right across the street. Right on the cable car run. Great staff and service.
reviews.title: BEST VALUE EVER!

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel from 25-Feb-2009 to 4-Mar-2009 and would like to highlight the excellent customer service we received from all the staff but especially Diana (front-desk), James (bellman) and the 2 concierges.
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service

reviews.text: We also had reservations at the J W Marriott but at the last minute based on reviews at this site decided to make reservations here instead. Yes, the hotel was still undergoing some renovations but we were not inconvenienced by it. The service, the large room, comfortable beds and location more than made up for it.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in a great location with brand new rooms and friendlt staff

reviews.text: I was travelling with my 73-year-old Mother and was worried beforehand about the how far the hotel was to the shopping area but in the end she found the short walk a breeze and was making several trips back to the hotel a day to unload her shopping bags.
reviews.title: Better, but still not there yet
Awful Customer Service
reviews.text: I also used the fitness center everyday and it was more than adequate. The TV screen on each cardio machine made my workout more enjoyable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our hotel stay for 4 nights about 2 months ahead and got a really good deal through Travelocity for about 88$ per night. The hotel is being renovated, so you cant really see the facade. But, as soon as you enter, its perfect. It's beautifully maintained(everything is brand new). We checked in late at night and the staff was very courteous and helpful. Room service is not 24 hours, that's the only thing you need to watch out for. We asked for and got a room on the 19th floor- away from all the street noise, and with a pretty good view. We had a glimpse of the bay even. The higher floors have even better view but they were still under renovation. The bathroom was clean and housekeeping was excellent. There isn't a business center, but they do have a computer attached to a printer just for printing your boarding passes and checking in online - that's good enough! It's right at the corner of Powell and Sutter - on the cable car line. Getting in at this stop is much better than walking down to union square where the lines are too long. There is a Starbucks right opposite the hotel. Walgreen and Loris diner are right across the street. Everything you could need is a block away at most. I repeat myself, but the location was perfect! Sorry, we forgot to take pics of the room. The bathroom toiletries were from bath and body works. The reception can provide maps and directions to most of the places you would want to visit. Chinatown is just 2 blocks away. Union square is about a block away. I would recommend not driving and parking in SF as the costs are high and public transport is readily available. Most places are a cab drive away at most.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, affordable and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our single king room on the 8th floor was large, quiet, and comfortable with a coffee maker but no refrigerator. The room was clean and newly renovated. Bed and sheets were comfortable, but the towels were rough. We only stayed Saturday night, and heard zero construction noise. The room had a large desk and comfortable office chair, but the small light on one side did not provide adequate illumination.
reviews.title: Confortable room--Expensive parking

likes.liked: — Loocation, size and comfort level of room

reviews.text: I thought the room rate of $134 plus tax was a bargain for the area, but parking was $46 plus $6 tax. The nearby Sutter Stockton garage ($33.50) is an option, especially for longer stays.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Stayed at Hotel 480 for 2 nights.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location.
reviews.title: Engagement Night

reviews.text: Crowne Plaza was sold and this hotel is now known as the "Hotel 480". Having stayed here before the change and now for 5 days after the change, I have a comparison that is not very favorable for the new ownership.
reviews.title: New Name, New Ownership, New Issues...

reviews.text: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION
reviews.title: Hotel 480 - Great Union Square Location

reviews.text: Before I go any further let's state the obvious. You cannot beat the location of this hotel, regardless of who owns it or what name is painted on the outside. Located one block north of Union Square, right on the cable car line and with ample public (read - much cheaper than the hotel parking) within a block - visitors to the city will appreciate the central location. We parked the car on arrival and had absolutely no need to use it for the whole week until departure.
reviews.title: Convenient location with great customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now the not so good news.,, Hopefully it's just the pains of transition causing some service issues but I have to say the majority of negatives with our stay were associated with the service.
reviews.title: Great Union Square Hotel Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had troubles with housekeeping opening a door clearly identified as "Do Not Disturb", phone calls from engineering at 6am about problems we never reported, etc. We were here with MacWorld and selected the hotel because it claimed free internet access for conference attendees - this was not so. This may be a problem with the MacWorld folks though. But once connected for the internet "broadband" - you're better off taking your chances on a modem. The internet access is terrible and in tremendous need of upgrade.
reviews.title: Excellent - great location
Good Choice
reviews.text: Stayed there during the easter week. Loved the location, close to Union Square shopping locations as well as cable car turnaround.

reviews.title: Very pleasant stay
reviews.text: Staff was particulary friendly and attentive; Room was conveniently sized; beds excellent. Breakfast buffet offers everything needed to start the day.

reviews.title: Loved Crowne Plaza
reviews.text: The only thing we would definitely not recommend is the food from the streetside Cafe Fresco belonging to the hotel. I would rank what is served there (at low cost of course) close to worst food in the world.

reviews.title: Thanks Crowne Plaza
reviews.text: Anyway, if we ever return to San Francisco, we will choose the Crowne Plaza Union Square again.

reviews.title: Great value
reviews.text: I booked hotwire and got a great deal. Staff were friendly and helpful, particularly the porters. The room was large with an extremely comfortable bed. Furnishings were bland but nice enough. Fantastic location right on Union Square, close to numerous shops and restaurants and a couple of blocks from Chinatown.
Positives -
reviews.title: Great Rooms, Good Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -close to many restaurants. Try the nearby Café Espresso or Sears Fine Foods for breakfast. The food court in the lower level of Macy’s is nice for a quick lunch.
reviews.title: great from start to finish
crowne plaza union square was GREAT
reviews.text: -close to the cable car & other public transportation lines. The $24 weekly pass is a good deal. The pass covers cable cars, buses & trolleys, but not BART.

reviews.title: A Work in Progress--Literally!
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel 480 for four nights after booking it through Priceline at a very reasonable rate. The location can't be beaten--it's about a block north of Union Square and just a few blocks from Chinatown (North Beach is also walkable if you can handle the steep hills in between). While I can't complain about the room--it was nicely appointed and clean--there were two major points of contention between the hotel's website and my experience. First, the hotel's fitness center is NOT OPEN. It's being renovated for the foreseeable future, which I hadn't known in advance (it would have been nice to be apprised of this!). The front desk said that they had made alternative arrangements with the 24 Hour Fitness located five blocks away, but that 480 guests would have to pay $5 per day to use the facility. I was horrified that they expected guests to pay for something which was supposed to be included--especially in light of the fact that it's WAY more inconvenient to use some strange gym than to just run downstairs to the hotel's own fitness center. When I expressed this, the manager offered to give me 2 days for $5, which I accepted (and by the way, the gym itself was pretty nice, but if you're a runner or a walker, you're SO much better off exercising outside because you get as much of a workout --no kidding, this city has some SERIOUS hills--and simultaneously get to enjoy exploring the city). I was still irked, though, that they charged me anything at all for something that I was promised when I booked (though I see that they've changed the website recently to reflect the situation).

Secondly, there is no wireless access in the guestrooms at all. If you want to access the Internet, you have to pay $10/day for a high-speed connection, or you can go sit in the lobby and pay $5 for three hours of wireless. Can you get more stingy? Considering San Francisco's supposed to be one of the most "wired" cities in the country, the fact that the hotel doesn't even provide wireless coverage in its guestrooms is disappointing. A better option than the $10 high-speed connection is to connect to the wireless network of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel (located across the street) which is only $7 per day and sent a pretty strong signal over to my guestroom (and probably all guestrooms on the south side of the building).
reviews.title: good location, average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the staff were fantastic, but these flaws left me feeling somewhat disappointed. Had I known these issues before booking, I would have adjusted my expectations (and knowing them now, I'd still probably stay there again if only for the unbeatable location), If you don't require in-room wireless or the use of gym facilities, I'd highly recommend the 480, but if you do, you might want to look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Good value for price

reviews.text: This hotel used to be a Crown Plaza and it still feels like one. Everything has been refreshed/updated, but very basic. Nothing is particularly wrong, but nothing wows you either. The location is great and the front desk service is exceptionally friendly and helpful. However, for this price, I felt like I wanted something more special.
reviews.title: Good Location - RUDE RUDE RUDE desk staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a great cheap price -- $160/nite. Excellent for the location in the shopping district of Union Square. The room was clean and partially updated with white linens and duvet. Walls seem thin, but no trouble with loud noise. Good workout room. Very helpful bellman, Perry, who got me bag back when I left it in the airport shuttle bus! Great value for the price
reviews.title: We love Hotel 480! Highly Recommend!!

reviews.text: my experience was awful. i was there for a conference, in the big ballroom. of course- very very weak wireless internet access and when you told the front desk--- they looked at you like you have 3 eyes. ditto on the weak net access from the rooms. what a joke-- why cant they get this right! first my key didnt work (same experience a guy next to me at checkin had). the rude front desk lady (who will go unnamed) kept insulting our intelligence saying we were putting in the card wrong. duh... next one of the bellmen took our tip, then handed the bags back to us-- true story... say he didnt have time to take the bags to our room. two positives were the very nice concierge lady (extremely helpful and patient) and the cleaning ladies (promote them please to the front desk). wow! the front desk needs alot of work. teach them the internet and that guests get frustrated when everywhere they turn, nothing works. and hey be nice. several of us were trying to print boarding passes at the front desk. they couldnt do it. and wouldnt let us look behind the counter to help. more rudeness. then we were instructed to go upstairs to the business center (read that money grab) where the fees were a joke, and (you guessed it) very SLOW internet access and a printer out of toner. think they had more? right, now way-- had to be ordered. all in all a bad experience, starting with the poorly managed front desk. this hotel needs a brand, the staff needs retraining, and the GM (who was nowhere to be found when all these problems were occurring) should spend some time with the guests. cant say enough about how the experience started negatively with a rude front desk person and zero help from all the bell staff standing around. oh- and did i mention that my tv volume control didnt work... i called the front desk, then the gm's office, and am still waiting for a call back (i checked out 3 days ago!). stay at the westin next time.
reviews.title: a RUDE awakening....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a month traveling through Austria, Germany, Italy and the Czech Republic and decided on a three day stopover in San Francisco on our way back to New Zealand to help get over our jet lag.
reviews.title: A City of Two Halves

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through our travel agent (our agent never contacted us to say it had changed names since we booked and paid) together with our flights. It was expensive but we thought with the Crowne Plaza name and having read other Trip Advisor reviews we would be happy. I had booked our nine hotels in Europe directly through their websites after reading Trip Advisor reviews. All of them were wonderful so we were looking forward to our three nights of luxury in San Francisco to finish an incredible month long trip.
reviews.title: Great location & staff

likes.disliked: — I prefer newer, more modern hotels

reviews.text: We arrived after two flights from Europe, 16 hours in total and checked in with no problems. We were taken to our room on the 10th floor and were told how lucky it was that we had such a huge one. We thought it was very dated and we were not very happy with two double beds instead of a queen or king as advertised, but it was tolerably clean. It was a disabled room with all the equipment left in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Hotel 480 is still a great place

reviews.text: The room was also very cold. While my husband tried to warm up the air conditioning I decided a shower would help the jet lag and the disappointment with the room. However there was no hot water!! We rang reception and they said the hotel was undergoing renovations and that they would send a plumber.
reviews.title: Great Location, large rooms, good, clean hotel

aka: San Francisco Marriott Union Square Hotel
description: The San Francisco Marriott Union Square hotel offers a prime location with San Francisco's most vibrant address. Hop aboard a cable car or enjoy Union Square shopping just steps from the hotel. Also near popular Nob Hill and Chinatown, the San Francisco Marriott Union Square is an excellent choice for hosting meetings and events.
